publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1949.1 Mark Ballard: Re-election of President George W Bush—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1949) in the name of Murdo Fraser, leave out from first "congratulates" to end and insert "expresses its concern that the re-election of President George W Bush will set back cross-Atlantic co-operation on issues of the environment and social justice for a further four years, thereby undermining the impact of the Parliament in these areas, as well as continuing to present a clear and present danger to world peace and stability through illegal invasions and warmongering."

S2M-1949.1 Mark Ballard: Re-election of President George W Bush—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1949) in the name of Murdo Fraser, leave out from first "congratulates" to end and insert "expresses its concern that the re-election of President George W Bush will set back cross-Atlantic co-operation on issues of the environment and social justice for a further four years, thereby undermining the impact of the Parliament in these areas, as well as continuing to present a clear and present danger to world peace and stability through illegal invasions and warmongering."
